goals.question: What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the count of each penguin species
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the proportion of each species in the dataset and if there is any class imbalance.

goals.question: What is the average body mass of each penguin species?
goals.visualization: Grouped box plot of body mass by species
goals.rationale: This helps us compare the body mass of each species and identify any significant differences.

goals.question: What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of flipper length vs body mass
goals.rationale: This helps us understand if there is a correlation between flipper length and body mass and if it varies by species.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bill length and depth by species?
goals.visualization: Faceted histogram of bill length and depth by species
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the range and distribution of bill length and depth for each species and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between body mass and sex?
goals.visualization: Grouped box plot of body mass by sex
goals.rationale: This helps us understand if there is a significant difference in body mass between male and female penguins.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    species_counts = data['species'].value_counts()
    species_counts.plot(kind='bar')
    plt.xlabel('Species')
    plt.ylabel('Count')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    species = data['species'].unique()
    body_mass_data = [data[data['species'] == s]['body_mass'] for s in species]
    plt.boxplot(body_mass_data, labels=species)
    plt.xlabel('Species')
    plt.ylabel('Body Mass')
    plt.title('What is the average body mass of each penguin species?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['flipper_length'], data['body_mass'])
    plt.xlabel('Flipper Length')
    plt.ylabel('Body Mass')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    g = sns.FacetGrid(data, col="species")
    g.map_dataframe(sns.histplot, x="bill_length_mm", y="bill_depth_mm", bins=20)
    g.set_axis_labels("Bill Length (mm)", "Bill Depth (mm)")
    plt.title("What is the distribution of bill length and depth by species?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = data.boxplot(column='body_mass', by='sex')
    plt.title("What is the relationship between body mass and sex?")
    plt.suptitle("")
    plt.xlabel("Sex")
    plt.ylabel("Body Mass")
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
